info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 15 at 9:11PM CDT until April 16 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN WOODRUFF...SOUTH CENTRAL INDEPENDENCE...SOUTHERN JACKSON AND NORTHEASTERN WHITE COUNTIES... At 910 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Russell, or 15 miles northwest of Augusta, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Newport... Diaz... Tupelo... Bradford... Weldon... Blackville... Olyphant... Shoffner... Thida... Ingleside... Stegall... Heffington... Erwin... Possum Grape... Denmark... Velvet Ridge... Fitzhugh... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 62 and 85. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for eastern, central and north central Arkansas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
